MemorialPage.title: MemorialPage
MemorialPage.description: Represents a memorial page created for a loved one.

id.description: Unique identifier for the memorial page.

authorId.description: The UID of the User who created the memorial page. (Relationship: User 1:N MemorialPage)

name.description: The name of the person being memorialized.

lifeSpan.description: The life span of the person (e.g., 1950 - 2024).

createdAt.description: Date and time when the memorial page was created.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed for scalability and clear access patterns. User data is private in `/users/{userId}`. Memorials are in a top-level `/memorials` collection to allow for public read access, which is crucial for sharing memorial pages. Write access to a specific memorial is controlled by checking the `authorId` field against the requesting user's UID in the security rules. Admin roles are managed via document existence in `/roles_admin/{userId}` for efficient role checking without needing a `get()` call in security rules. This structure separates concerns, simplifies security rules, and supports both private user data and public content efficiently.
